rev.comment: what does that even mean? probably original research and POV
rev.diff:
Line 44: Line 44:
=== Copyright and free software ===
=== Copyright and free software ===
â
Certain [[Free software|free software]] licenses (most notably [[GPL]]) substantially rely on existing copyright law. It is not possible to enforce GPL other than within the framework of existing copyright law.<ref>[http://www.brainhandles.com/techno-thoughts/technology-life/should-copyright-be-abolished Should copyright be abolished]</ref><ref>[http://www.groklaw.net/articlebasic.php?story=20041028000105896 The Sustainable GPL]</ref> As GPL being strongly associated with word [[Copyleft]], there is certain confusion about GPL and copyright, but despite somewhat confusing wording, ''copyleft'' is indeed one (unprivative) of copyright licensing schemas.
+
Certain [[Free software|free software]] licenses (most notably [[GPL]]) substantially rely on existing copyright law. It is not possible to enforce GPL other than within the framework of existing copyright law.<ref>[http://www.brainhandles.com/techno-thoughts/technology-life/should-copyright-be-abolished Should copyright be abolished]</ref><ref>[http://www.groklaw.net/articlebasic.php?story=20041028000105896 The Sustainable GPL]</ref> As GPL being strongly associated with word [[Copyleft]], there is certain confusion about GPL and copyright, but despite somewhat confusing wording, ''copyleft'' is indeed one of copyright licensing schemas.
== Anti-copyright infringement organizations ==
== Anti-copyright infringement organizations ==
